intro: Tenaxia disticha var. lustricola, commonly known as the glossy leaf tenaxia, is a variant of the tenaxia plant characterized by its shiny, dark green foliage. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The leaves are typically arranged in pairs along the stem, giving it a distinctive appearance. This variety is often found in moist, shaded environments, thriving in woodland or streamside habitats. Its botanical features make it a unique subject for study in ecological and horticultural contexts.
